intro: Tozzia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican tozzia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and aromatic, while its flowers are small and greenish-white in color. Tozzia mexicana is often found in mountainous regions and is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche.
